{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3655523,"name":"Ahmet Doruk Gönülal","username":"adg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adg/{size}/248108_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-16T20:49:24.169Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

Our team is working on a custom vision setup using PhotonVision on an Orange Pi 5. We’re aiming to replicate the functionality of a Limelight by using PhotonVision for both AprilTag-based localization and object detection (for game pieces).

We’re looking for a camera recommendation that is:

  • Compatible with PhotonVision and Orange Pi 5 (USB or MIPI),
  • Low latency and good frame rates,
  • Performs well under varying lighting conditions (FRC field lighting),
  • Suitable for both AprilTag tracking and object detection.

If you’ve used a specific camera successfully in a similar setup, we’d love to hear your experience and recommendations.

Thanks in advance!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-06-16T20:49:24.169Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":76,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":416.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503270,"topic_slug":"best-camera-recommendation-for-photonvision","display_username":"Ahmet Doruk Gönülal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6429 | electronics, programming"},"post_url":"/t/best-camera-recommendation-for-photonvision/503270/1","custom_user_title":"6429 | electronics, programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3655546,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-16T21:22:59.069Z","cooked":"

We have found after this last season that the ThrifyBot ThriftyCam is really solid in terms of both reliability and performance. It comes in a billet case with threaded screw holes so that you can use locking USB cables. Their camera is also compatible with multiple FOV lens options so that you can choose the right one for the application.

We were able to achieve max frame rates (60) at all times via our Minisforumn PC with 3+ cameras hooked up.

We only used these cameras for AprilTag detection, but it was discovered late in the season by another team that the sensor used by the ThriftyCam is color capable meaning it has potential use in object detection as well.

For the price it’s one of the best options to get going quickly with a robust camera solution for custom or PhotonVision based robot vision.

The Thrifty Bot

ThriftyCam

The ThriftyCam utilizes the OMNIVISION OG02B1B B&W CMOS 2 Megapixel (1600x1304) Global Shutter Image Sensor with OmniPixel®3-GS Technology. At full resolution, the camera will present 60 frames per second over USB 3.0. For maximum performance, we...

Price: USD 109.99

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-06-16T21:22:59.069Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":162.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503270,"topic_slug":"best-camera-recommendation-for-photonvision","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.thethriftybot.com/products/thriftycam","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"ThriftyCam","clicks":39}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/best-camera-recommendation-for-photonvision/503270/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3655561,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-16T21:39:50.897Z","cooked":"

If you want both localization and game pieces, you’ll want to grab an OV9782 ; This is a color variant of the well trusted and tested OV9781 camera. We used this last year with great success on an Orange Pi+Photonvision setup. It handled localization without issue, and while we didn’t run in comps, we did get a CV model running for coral detection. For a $10 cost delta, it’s well worth grabbing one or two of these as part of your rollout.

The issue you’ll probably run up against with the B+W variants is that it reduces a lot of data space for detection, and also makes it tricky to use other teams’ training models or photo sets.

For AprilTag detection you will definitely want a global shutter camera to minimize the rolling shutter effect. Here’s an image demonstration from the PhotonVision documentation demonstrating it:

(All the cameras mentioned so far are global shutter cameras, but nobody’s mentioned it specifically yet.)

Most of the teams use OV9782 model because of the high fps and resolution. Its also good at recognition of the game pieces and localization. It is also compatible with Orange Pi.

JohnFogarty:

ThrifyBot ThriftyCam

+1. Ran 2 of these on our robot and loved the results. I think the USB 3.0 helps cut down on compression so you get better corner detection. Noticeably lowered ambiguity.

Would also definitely recommend the locking USB cables. USB C’s latch is so weak. Without any evidence it feels a good bit weaker than USB Micro.

Only complaint about these cameras is the lens focus can be pretty sensitive. We eventually hot glued them and that seemed to work well.
